attributes.action: The House of Commons to vote to hold an early general election.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011, an election may be held early in only three cases:

-A vote of no confidence.
-The House of Commons, by a two-thirds majority, votes to hold an early election.
-The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act is repealed/modified (this isn't a provision of the Act, it just applies to all legislation).
attributes.background:
The British public do not want an unelected Conservative PM. We demand the right to hold another General Election and would like the House of Commons to approve this motion.

We want a Prime Minister that we actually democratically elect, not one that is forced upon us.
